title: Nice hotel/great location
text: Stayed one night only on a Heathrow layover. Hotel room was quiet and fairly large and featured a view of the castle. Very convenient to many restaurants and shops. Price was reasonable compared to nearby properties.. Would stay again.

title: Surprisingly good
text: Had passed this restaurant many times in recent years, but never entered. There was usually a guy waiving menus out front which is rarely a sign of quality. But we wanted Italian and didn’t want to walk too far in the rain, so we stopped in. We were very surprised by the overall quality of the dishes and would go there again.

title: Average
text: Gail’s was very reminiscent of Starbuck’s but with a better selection of baked goods. Very busy mid-morning; we couldn’t get a seat. Wouldn’t go out of my way to shop there again.

title: Amazing
text: There isn’t a lot to see here, so you have to imagine what this must have been like in Aristotle’s time, Its close to the Byzantine Museum and Museum of Cycladic art, so we did all three the same day.

title: Nice Collection
text: Stopped briefly at this museum on our visit to the Ancient Agora. Very nice collection of artifacts. Very crowded in late October.

title: A must see
text: The Ancient Agora is quite large especially considering that it is in the heart of Athens. We had a most enjoyable stroll around the grounds and the Temple is spectacular. We visited on our own; if I had to do it again, I would join a guided tour.

title: Great mosaics
text: A small but excellent museum at the Ancient Corinth archaeological site. Mosaics and busts were especially well preserved.

title: Interesting Site
text: If you are visiting Corinth, the canal is not to be missed. Our driver had a video on his laptop describing the history of the canal as well as how ships were transported overland in the centuries before the canal was built — really fascinating.

title: Good site for brief visit
text: Extensive archaeological site located in central Athens. Thought provoking and evocative of times gone bye.

title: Interesting place
text: If you are visiting Athens for the first time, the Monastiraki Flea Market is a place you should visit. Many interesting, off-beat items for sale. While my wife and I didn’t purchase anything, we were indeed tempted.

title: Where the action is
text: It seems that all roads lead to Monastiraki Square. Many walking tours start here. It can be incredibly crowded even in Shoulder Season. But still a place you will want to experience at least once.

title: Remarkable
text: Well worth the trek to the top of the Acropolis. Try to arrive early to avoid crowds and heat. Non-slip footwear is a must although I did see people in flip flops. Condition of the Parthenon is quite good.

title: Interesting collection
text: Large museum with a well presented collection. Since it has a relatively narrow focus, it may not be everyone’s cup-of-tea. Has cafe for a bit of lunch or a coffee break.

title: Interesting
text: Museum of Cycladic Art is a small museum but one worth visiting. We visited the same day we visited Aristotle’s Lyceum and the Museum of Byzantine and Christian Art as all three are very close to each other. The Museum of Cycladic Art has a cafe and a nice gift shop.

title: The place to be in Athens
text: Most of the top attractions in Athens seem to be located in or near the Plaka neighborhood. Restaurants, shops, and hotels are plentiful.There are several pedestrianized zones that making strolling a pleasure. The area seems very safe.

title: Nice dinner for two
text: We had been told by a neighbor that they had had a good meal at the Plaka Taverna. We weren’t looking for the place, but just happened to pass it while strolling before dinner and decided to give it a try. The meal was good and the pricing, especially for a glass of wine, was very good. They have lots of outdoor seating. Don’t be turned off by the annoying fellow waving menus at you as you approach.

title: Great restaurant
text: We ate three times at Evgenia over the course of a week, that’s how impressed we were with the food and service. They serve what I would consider to be traditional Greek dishes. The menu varies from day to day. The place is small with some outdoor seating. Wait staff is always attentive without being intrusive.

title: Amazing
text: Really didn’t know what to expect at the Acropolis Museum, but the manner in which it displayed Parthenon artifacts was quite spectacular. They also have a very good on site cafe. Be sure not to miss the archaeological site below the museum.

title: World Class Site
text: What can you say about the Acropolis. Obviously one of the world’s spectacular sites. Recommend that you visit as early in the day as possible to avoid crowds and heat. Although my wife and I are in our mid 60s and mid 70s respectively, we did not find the ascent overly demanding, but there are some steps along the way that pose a tripping hazard if you are not wary. Also, slippery spots up top.

title: Great Dinner
text: We visited this restaurant based on good TripAdvisor reviews and we were not disappointed. The staff was attentive and provided lots of information on the wine we had selected. Food was good and we did not feel rushed to vacate our table.

title: Perfect Stay
text: Spent 8 nights at the Electra Palace and would definitely stay there again. We had a room on the 6th Floor with a great view of the Acropolis which was brilliantly illuminated at night. The room was large, clean, and quiet. Breakfast in the 8th Floor restaurant was varied and the view was marvelous. Very nice ground floor bar for which we were given 2 free drinks upon check in. Excellent restaurant on the corner and a small supermarket called Bazaar 2 short blocks away.

title: Great day trip from Athens
text: Was looking for a day trip from Athens that wasn’t too far afield. We decided on Ancient Corinth and it proved to be a good choice. The museum that was part of the archaeological site was especially interesting. The road adjacent to the site had numerous shops and eateries. Probably did the bulk of our souvenir shopping there and not in Athens.

title: Excellent Airline
text: Flew Aegean Air for the first time in October 2019. Went round trip between London and Athens on a A320 aircraft in Business Class. The comfort and level of service was top notch. Since Aegean doesn’t have a lounge at Heathrow, we were able to use the Lufthansa lounge. Try to get the first row of Business Class for the extra legroom if you can. Highly recommend this Airline.

title: Small but interesting museum
text: A free museum with a collection of antiquities. Visited on a rainy day and, not really knowing what to expect, was pleasantly surprised. Sixty minutes should be sufficient for most visitors.
place: Museo di Scultura Antica Giovanni Barracco

title: Memorable meal
text: Met our guide and took a leisurely stroll to sample some local meats and cheeses then we arrived at the restaurant for the main event. The pastas and wine were excellent. Service was friendly and efficient. Our guide answered our questions and provided interesting stories about the Trastevere neighborhood. After dinner, we continued our stroll and had some gelato; the gelato was about average. Highly recommend.
place: The 4 Roman Pastas Tasting Tour in Rome

title: Excellent dinner
text: Booked this dinner and wine event through Viator. The 2 ladies who were the “guides” spoke excellent English and were most pleasant. The food was of the highest quality and had we been staying longer in Rome we would have returned to the restaurant for an encore. There were 14 people in the party; so we were split into 2 groups. Enjoyed some interesting conversation with our fellow diners. A fun evening — highly recommend.
place: Semi Private Dinner near the Pantheon, Wine Pairing and Visit to Ancient Cellar

title: Tivoli villas
text: Booked a six hour day trip to Tivoli and had a great time. While I am not much of a fan of gardens and fountains, I had to admit that Villa D’Este’s grounds were impressive. But my favorite stop was Hadrian’s Villa, a vast complex featuring some incredible ruins is not to be missed. Highly recommend you scheduled a visit to Tivoli on your Rome vacation.
place: Tivoli Tours - Villa D'Este - Hadrian's Villa- Tours

title: Interesting archaeological site
text: Somewhat tricky to locate site near Trajans column. Good tour, very informative look at how well off Romans lived. Not one of the better known tourist attractions in Rome, but after you’ve visited the top tier sites, Palazzo Valentini is a worthwhile stop.

title: Historic University
text: Magnificent architecture and woodwork. We had hired a local guide via Tours by Locals for a brief tour of Bologna’s highlights and were glad that we did. She really helped us understand the history of the school and how medical students were trained in the operating theatre.

title: Must visit site in Bologna
text: Spent a few hours in Bologna mostly to sample local foods and wine, but we did visit San Petronio. Very interesting Basilica that apparently was never finished. Near the historic Bologna University. Easy to do both in a couple of hours.

title: Early Access to Vatican Museum
text: Everything went as scheduled. We entered the museum by 0730. Made our way to the Sistine Chapel before it became at all crowded. Then after exploring other areas of the museum, we were able to use the “short cut” out of the museum to St Peter’s Basilica— saving a 30 minute walk. Well worth the cost. Highly recommend.

title: Very interesting site
text: I found this Etruscan necropolis to be incredible. If you are fascinated by the Forum or the Palatine Hill in Rome, you’ll likely find the necropolis a special place as well. The visit really peaked my interest in learning more about their culture. As a result, a few days later we went to view the Etruscan art and artifacts at the Villa Giulia in Rome — another incredible place.

title: Perfect trip to Tivoli
text: Took the 6 hour day trip to Tivoli and everything was great. The driver picked us up on schedule. She was very pleasant and her English was good. At the end of the day she dropped us at a restaurant of our choosing in Rome for a late lunch. Her vehicle was clean and comfortable. Could not ask for more. Highly recommend.

title: Interesting place
text: Had passed this museum many times before and hadn’t paid it much attention; it was never on my itinerary. Since we were staying in Piazza Navona and had some time to kill, we went in and were pleasantly surprised. Spent about 1.5 hours and could have spent twice that if we had the time. Lots of informative exhibits on the history of the city.

title: A Special Place
text: Visited the pontifical villa in early April and the place was practically deserted. Being able to visit the Pope’s bedroom and to check out some of the Pope-mobiles were among the highlights of our visit. The town featured some interesting shops and some great views of the lake. After you’ve seen the major sites in Rome, you might want to consider a trip to Castel Gandolfo.

title: A special place
text: My wife and I had dinner at the Casa Bleve for her birthday and we would highly recommend. The service was friendly and responsive without being intrusive. Great ambiance We had three courses and everything was excellent. The cheeses were especially tasty.

title: Hidden gem
text: Located at the northern entrance to Piazza Navona, the Tuscan Platter serves delicious, freshly prepared sandwiches that make for a great lunch. The quality of the meats and cheeses is first rate. There are tables, and they serve more than sandwiches, but that was all we had on the two occasions we stopped there. Highly recommend.

title: Excellent tour guide
text: Used More of Rome for a guided tour of San Clemente Basilica. Our guide, Dmitry, spoke excellent English, was knowledgeable, and had a passion for his subject. Highly recommend.

title: Average
text: Well situated across from northern entrance to Piazza Navona. We stopped by for a takeaway lunch. The pizza I had was OK, but the rice ball my wife had was not that good. Overall, there are better choices nearby like Bread In or the Tuscan Platter./Taglieri Panini.

title: Good spot for lunch
text: After a week in Rome, I was craving a burger. My wife and I stopped at the Trinity College Pub for a lunch of burgers, French fries and beer. The food was good. The service was excellent. Pricing was reasonable. Would go there again.

title: Great food
text: On a two week trip to Rome, we were looking for a good Chinese restaurant near our Piazza Navona hotel. Based on TripAdvisor reviews, we visited Stella d’Oro, and were not disappointed. Service was prompt and courteous. The food was fresh and tasty. Good menu choices and reasonable prices. Good for families. Recommend.

title: Impressive collection
text: After a visit to the Etruscan necropolis at Cerveteri peaked our interest in this ancient culture, we went to Villa Giulia. A beautiful building set on park like grounds, it houses a truly vast collection of imaginatively displayed Etruscan art and artifacts. Even on a Saturday, it was not at all crowded. A welcome change from many Roman museums. Excellent audio guide. Highly recommend.
place: Museo Nazionale Etrusco di Villa Giulia

title: Excellent tour guide
text: My wife and I had visited San Clemente 20 years ago on our own, and while we enjoyed our visit, we realized that having a knowledgeable guide would have greatly enhanced the experience. This time we used More of Rome and were happy we did. Our guide, Dmitry, was terrific. He was personable, and had extensive knowledge of the history of the Basilica. Highly recommend.
place: Rome's Saint Clement's Basilica - 90-minute tour in English

title: A real gem
text: We had visited San Clemente years ago on our own and enjoyed the experience, but this place is so full of history ,we thought we should use a guide this time. Our guide from More of Rome was great. The hours flew by. We would recommend both San Clemente and More of Rome tours.

title: Excellent guided tour
text: We used Roads to Rome for a private tour of the Etruscan necropolis in Cerveteri. Our guide Giovanni was quite the scholar on Etruscan history and really peaked our interest in learning more about their civilization. Had we stayed longer in Rome, we would have booked another tour with him. Highly recommended.

title: Excellent pasta
text: We ate at Casa Mia as part of a Trastevere walking and dining tour. Service was excellent as were the pasta courses we sampled. Cozy atmosphere. Would go there again, definitely.

title: Location, location, location
text: Bernini is well situated within the Piazza Navona. You can dine outside and watch the passing parade of visitors. The food was good, but the glass of wine my wife ordered had to be the smallest pour ever; better off ordering a bottle.

title: Outstanding
text: Based on traveler reviews, we ate at Carpranica and were not disappointed. Vast wine selection. Attentive service. Excellent pasta. Warm atmosphere. We ate there again a few days later and probably would have eaten there a third time, but it was Monday and they were closed. Highly recommend.

title: Simply Great
text: My wife and I had one of the best meals ever at Anima. It was our last night in Rome and since had an early departure the next morning, we were having an early dinner at 1730. Anima was open so we went in. The prices were reasonable; the portions were quite substantial. The octopus salad was fresh and tasty. The rigatoni alla gricia and the tonnarelli cacio e pepe were exceptional. Staff was very friendly and attentive. Warm atmosphere in interior — we chose to eat inside as it was rather cool that evening. Highly recommend.

title: Top flight seafood dishes
text: While touring the Castelli Romani, we ate lunch at Pagnanelli on the recommendation of our guide. The restaurant was situated in a great location overlooking the lake. I had the scallop dish which was remarkable. The suggested wine complimented the food perfectly. Warm atmosphere and attentive staff. Highly recommend.

title: Heart of Rome
text: I’ve been visiting Rome and the Piazza for nearly 20 years and am happy to see that the quality of the Restaurants and street entertainers has continued to improve. Thought the Michael Jackson and Joe Cocker imitators were quite good. There is always a lot going on from morning to the wee hours.

title: Very nice Mexican restaurant near Piazza Navona
text: Very fresh and tasty Mexican dishes. We had the good fortune of having all food and drinks at half price; so our 85 euro check was reduced to 42.50. We tried 2 different margaritas and they were fine but not noteworthy. Staff was very helpful and attentive.

title: Terrific day in the Roman countryside
text: Highly recommend this tour. Nemi was an interesting little town. But the high point was Castel Gandolfo and the one time Summer residence of the Pope. The audio guide tour was informative and the display of papal vehicles was a highlight. Our guide recommended lunch at Ristorante Pagnanelli where we a an excellent lunch while enjoying the magnificent lake view.
place: Tour to the Roman castles: Nemi, Ariccia and Castel Gandolfo, a day from Rome

title: Outstanding hotel
text:
One of the best hotels I’ve ever been in. All staff are friendly and incredibly helpful. We were visiting Rome for my wife’s birthday, and they surprised her with a cake.

We stayed in the Presidential Suite, which was quite roomy. Bath is huge with an easy to operate shower and lots of hot water. Bed was firm and comfortable. All areas very clean.

World class view over the famous Piazza Navona. Noise was not an issue when windows are closed.

title: Memorable meal
text: Can’t praise L’Arcimboldo enough. Small place, maybe holds 30. Reservations are a good idea; people were turned away when we ate Sunday lunch there. Staff are friendly, courteous, and attentive. But it’s all about the food. The tortellini and tortellini were excellent.

title: A hidden gem
text: Went to the Grunin Center for the first time in September 2018 to see a musical. It’s a small venue so every seat affords a good view. Acoustics are good. Parking is free. We returned a couple of months later for a concert. Definitely a place to put on your radar if you enjoy live performances.
place: Jay and Linda Grunin Center for the Arts

title: Top notch
text: My wife and I had dinner at Juanito’s, and really enjoyed everything about the experience. Staff was friendly and attentive. Chips were good, not at all greasy or overly salted. We had the enchiladas Del Mar and it was excellent. Many families dining on a Friday night. It’s BYOB.

title: Perfect location
text: Had breakfast at the Food Shack and found the food to be good and the service prompt and friendly. The bacon and home fries were really tasty while the eggs and pancakes were average. The water view was spectacular.

title: Great location, average food
text: Based on the recommendation of a neighbor, my wife and I reserved a table at the Shrimp Box during a recent weekend trip. Very nice location with water views. The service was very attentive and friendly, The food was average. Nice salad bar and excellent scallop appetizer. The rest of the food we had, fried calamari, crab cakes, flounder filet, was so-so. The broiled shrimp was dry and relatively tasteless. If you want seafood in Point Pleasant, I’d look elsewhere.
place: The Shrimp Box & Outside The Box Patio Bar

title: Great Thai Food
text: We were cruising around looking for a place to have dinner and happened upon the Jasmine ToGo. Despite the name, you can dine in. The mixed appetizer platter was very good, especially the spring rolls and steamed dumplings. The service was attentive and friendly. Prices were moderate. Would highly recommend.
